abstract.p: Furniture pieces by young Swedish designers Anya Sebton and Gunilla Allard introduced at ICF design showroom noted; photo (Currents column) (S)

block.p: A new generation of Scandinavian design is arriving in New York. On Tuesday, Scandinavia House, a sleek new cultural center and exhibition space by James Stewart Polshek, opens at 58 Park Avenue. And last week, pieces by two young Swedish designers were introduced at ICF, a design showroom. Millibar bar stools, above, made of chrome and transparent polyester fabric in a range of colors, are $950 each. Multiplicity, a lounge chair ($960 in wool) can be linked with others, below, to form a sofa. Both are by Anya Sebton. A chrome serving cart with shelves of leather, glass or laminate by Gunilla Allard (not shown) was inspired by Eileen Gray. ICF is at 920 Broadway (22nd Street).

Millibar bar stools, above, made of chrome and transparent polyester fabric in a range of colors, are $950 each. Multiplicity, a lounge chair ($960 in wool) can be linked with others, below, to form a sofa. Both are by Anya Sebton. A chrome serving cart with shelves of leather, glass or laminate by Gunilla Allard (not shown) was inspired by Eileen Gray. ICF is at 920 Broadway (22nd Street).
